==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|けい|はん|しん|yomi=o}}
{{wikipedia|Keihanshin}}

===Etymology===
From the first character of {{m|ja|京都||[[Kyoto]]|sc=Jpan}},
the second character of {{m|ja|大阪||[[Osaka]]|sc=Jpan}},
and the first character of {{m|ja|神戸||[[Kobe]]|sc=Jpan}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|けいはんしん|acc=3}}
* Kyoto-Osaka Accent: {{ja-accent-common|nakadaka||けいは|んしん|kéíháǹshìǹ}}

===Proper noun===
{{ja-pos|proper|けいはんしん}}
# The cities of Kyōto, Ōsaka and Kōbe (in the [[Kansai]] region).
# The area around Kyōto, Ōsaka and Kōbe.

====Related terms====
* {{ja-r|京阪|けいはん}}: [[Kyoto]] and [[Osaka]]
* {{ja-r|阪神|^はんしん}}: [[Osaka]] and [[Kobe]]

===See also===
